Documentation.content: Returns the first string with all characters within the second string removed.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being tested.
filter The string containing the set of characters to be excluded.

Documentation.content: Returns the first string with all characters not within the second string removed.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being tested.
filter The string containing the set of characters to be included.

Documentation.content: Returns the source string with the replacement character substituted for all characters included in the filter string. MORE: Should this be a general string substitution?
Documentation.param: src The string that is being tested.
filter The string containing the set of characters to be included.
replace_char The character to be substituted into the result.

Documentation.content: Returns the source string with the replacement character substituted for all characters not included in the filter string. MORE: Should this be a general string substitution?
Documentation.param: src The string that is being tested.
filter The string containing the set of characters to be included.
replace_char The character to be substituted into the result.

Documentation.content: Returns the character position of the nth match of the search string with the first string. If no match is found the attribute returns 0. If an instance is omitted the position of the first instance is returned.
Documentation.param: src The string that is searched
sought The string being sought.
instance Which match instance are we interested in?

Documentation.content: Tests if the search string contains the supplied word as a whole word.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being tested.
word The word to be searched for.
ignore_case Whether to ignore differences in case between characters.

Documentation.content: Returns the character position of the nth match of the search string with the first string. If no match is found the attribute returns 0. If an instance is omitted the position of the first instance is returned.
Documentation.param: src The string that is searched
sought The string being sought.
instance Which match instance are we interested in?
locale_name The locale to use for the comparison

Documentation.content: Returns the character position of the nth match of the search string with the first string. If no match is found the attribute returns 0. If an instance is omitted the position of the first instance is returned.
Documentation.param: src The string that is searched
sought The string being sought.
instance Which match instance are we interested in?
locale_name The locale to use for the comparison

strength The strength of the comparison 1 ignores accents and case, differentiating only between letters 2 ignores case but differentiates between accents. 3 differentiates between accents and case but ignores e.g. differences between Hiragana and Katakana 4 differentiates between accents and case and e.g. Hiragana/Katakana, but ignores e.g. Hebrew cantellation marks 5 differentiates between all strings whose canonically decomposed forms (NFD�Normalization Form D) are non-identical

Documentation.content: Returns the nth element from a comma separated string.
Documentation.param: src The string containing the comma separated list.
instance Which item to select from the list.

Documentation.content: Returns the argument string with all upper case characters converted to lower case.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being converted.

Documentation.content: Return the argument string with all lower case characters converted to upper case.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being converted.

Documentation.content: Returns the upper case variant of the string using the rules for a particular locale.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being converted.
locale_name The locale to use for the comparison

Documentation.content: Returns the lower case variant of the string using the rules for a particular locale.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being converted.
locale_name The locale to use for the comparison

Documentation.content: Returns the upper case variant of the string using the rules for a particular locale.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being converted.
locale_name The locale to use for the comparison

Documentation.content: Returns the upper case variant of the string using the rules for a particular locale.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being converted.
locale_name The locale to use for the comparison

Documentation.content: Compares the two strings case insensitively. Equivalent to comparing at strength 2.
Documentation.param: src1 The first string to be compared.
src2 The second string to be compared.

Documentation.content: Compares the two strings case insensitively. Equivalent to comparing at strength 2.
Documentation.param: src1 The first string to be compared.
src2 The second string to be compared.

strength The strength of the comparison 1 ignores accents and case, differentiating only between letters 2 ignores case but differentiates between accents. 3 differentiates between accents and case but ignores e.g. differences between Hiragana and Katakana 4 differentiates between accents and case and e.g. Hiragana/Katakana, but ignores e.g. Hebrew cantellation marks 5 differentiates between all strings whose canonically decomposed forms (NFD�Normalization Form D) are non-identical

Documentation.content: Compares the two strings case insensitively. Equivalent to comparing at strength 2.
Documentation.param: src1 The first string to be compared.
src2 The second string to be compared.
locale_name The locale to use for the comparison

Documentation.content: Compares the two strings case insensitively. Equivalent to comparing at strength 2.
Documentation.param: src1 The first string to be compared.
src2 The second string to be compared.
locale_name The locale to use for the comparison

strength The strength of the comparison 1 ignores accents and case, differentiating only between letters 2 ignores case but differentiates between accents. 3 differentiates between accents and case but ignores e.g. differences between Hiragana and Katakana 4 differentiates between accents and case and e.g. Hiragana/Katakana, but ignores e.g. Hebrew cantellation marks 5 differentiates between all strings whose canonically decomposed forms (NFD�Normalization Form D) are non-identical

Documentation.content: Returns the argument string with all characters in reverse order. Note the argument is not TRIMMED before it is reversed.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being reversed.

Documentation.content: Returns the source string with the replacement string substituted for all instances of the search string.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being transformed.
sought The string to be replaced.
replacement The string to be substituted into the result.

Documentation.content: Returns the source string with the replacement string substituted for all instances of the search string.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being transformed.
sought The string to be replaced.
replacement The string to be substituted into the result.
locale_name The locale to use for the comparison

Documentation.content: Returns the source string with the replacement string substituted for all instances of the search string.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being transformed.
sought The string to be replaced.
replacement The string to be substituted into the result.
locale_name The locale to use for the comparison
strength The strength of the comparison

Documentation.content: Returns the source string with all accented characters replaced with unaccented.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being transformed.

Documentation.content: Returns the source string with all instances of multiple adjacent space characters (2 or more spaces together) reduced to a single space character. Leading and trailing spaces are removed, and tab characters are converted to spaces.
Documentation.param: src The string to be cleaned.

Documentation.content: Tests if the search string matches the pattern. The pattern can contain wildcards '?' (single character) and '*' (multiple character).
Documentation.param: src The string that is being tested.
pattern The pattern to match against.
ignore_case Whether to ignore differences in case between characters

Documentation.content: Tests if the search string contains each of the characters in the pattern. If the pattern contains duplicate characters those characters will match once for each occurence in the pattern.
Documentation.param: src The string that is being tested.
pattern The pattern to match against.
ignore_case Whether to ignore differences in case between characters

Documentation.content: Returns the minimum edit distance between the two strings. An insert change or delete counts as a single edit. The two strings are trimmed before comparing.
Documentation.return: The minimum edit distance between the two strings.
Documentation.param: _left The first string to be compared.
_right The second string to be compared.
localname The locale to use for the comparison. Defaults to ''.

Documentation.content: Returns true if the minimum edit distance between the two strings is with a specific range. The two strings are trimmed before comparing.
Documentation.return: Whether or not the two strings are within the given specified edit distance.
Documentation.param: _left The first string to be compared.
_right The second string to be compared.
radius The maximum edit distance that is accepable.
localname The locale to use for the comparison. Defaults to ''.

Documentation.content: Returns the number of words in the string. Word boundaries are marked by the unicode break semantics.
Documentation.return: The number of words in the string.
Documentation.param: text The string to be broken into words.
localname The locale to use for the break semantics. Defaults to ''.

Documentation.content: Returns the n-th word from the string. Word boundaries are marked by the unicode break semantics.
Documentation.return: The number of words in the string.
Documentation.param: text The string to be broken into words.
n Which word should be returned from the function.
localname The locale to use for the break semantics. Defaults to ''.
